dfischer.utils

Class ParseUrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ParseUrl
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParseUrlCgi

    public class ParseUrl
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses an URL and extracts the protocol, the host, the port and the file.
    Examples: 
     asdtfasfdzasf                             relative URL (file)
 /asdtzasf?asdas&x=2                       relative URL (file)
 http://www.zzz.dom                        absolute URL without file
 https://www.zzz.dom/asdtzasf?asdas&x=2    absolute URL with file
 http://www.zzz.dom:89/asdt                absolute URL with non-default port and file
    See Also:
    isValid, isAbsolute

    • Method Detail

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl()
        Returns a copy (clone) of the unparsed input-url.
        Returns:
        a copy (clone) of the unparsed input-url

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Reports if the URL is valid.
        Returns:
        true if the URL is valid

      • isAbsolute

        public boolean isAbsolute()
        Reports if the URL is absolute.
        Returns:
        true if the URL is absolute

      • getProtocol

        public java.lang.String getProtocol()
        Returns the protocol of the URL.
        Returns:
        the protocol of the URL in lowercase if the URL is absolute or null if the URL is relative.

      • getHost

        public java.lang.String getHost()
        Returns the host of the URL (including the domain) - or the TCP/IP address.
        Returns:
        the host of the URL if the URL is absolute or null if the URL is relative.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the TCP/IP port number of the URL. If no port number is given, the protocol specific default port number is returned. Supported protocols are http, https and ftp.
        Returns:
        the TCP/IP port number if the URL is absolute or -1 if the URL is relative. Returns also -1 for unsupported protocols.

      • hasDefaultPort

        public boolean hasDefaultPort()
        Reports if the specified protocol uses the protocol specific default port.
        Returns:
        true if the specified URL is absolute and the protocol uses its default port. Returns always true if the URL is relative.

      • getFile

        public java.lang.String getFile()
        Returns the file of the URL including optionally CGI parameters
        Returns:
        the file of the URL including optionally CGI parameters or null if the URL contains no file.

      • getFileOrBlank

        public java.lang.String getFileOrBlank()
        Returns the file of the URL including optionally CGI parameters
        Returns:
        the file of the URL including optionally CGI parameters or a empty string if the URL contains no file.

      • reconstructHostHeaderField

        public static java.lang.String reconstructHostHeaderField(java.lang.String protocol,
                                          java.lang.String host,
                                          int port)
        Reconstructs the HTTP request "Host" header field.
        Parameters:
        protocol - http or https
        host - hostname or TCP/IP address
        port - TCP/IP port
        Returns:
        <host>[:<port>], adds the port number only if no standard port is used for the specific protocol.
